decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to generate mana and draw cards quickly in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. By utilizing cards like High Tide, Peer Through Depths, and Ideas Unbound, the player can effectively set up a combo that allows them to chain multiple powerful spells together. Additionally, cards like Psychic Puppetry and Merchant Scroll help to search for key combo pieces to ensure consistent execution of the combo.

This deck revolves around creating a strong defensive wall of creatures to generate mana and combo off with cards like Freed from the Real and Galvanic Alchemist. By utilizing walls like Overgrown Battlement and Axebane Guardian, the deck can ramp up quickly while using cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way to draw into key combo pieces. The goal is to create a board state that is difficult for the opponent to break through while setting up an infinite mana combo to cast powerful spells or abilities to secure the win.

The main focus of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Elf creatures. By utilizing cards like Jaspera Sentinel, Quirion Ranger, and Birchlore Rangers to ramp up mana production, the deck can quickly generate a large board presence. Cards like Wellwisher and Priest of Titania help to keep the Elf army healthy and growing. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way provide card advantage to keep the aggression going. Timberwatch Elf can pump up the team for a big final push while Nyxborn Hydra can serve as a finisher.

The main focus of this Pauper 1 vs 1 Control Gates deck is to establish control through the use of various Gates cards and powerful enchantments. By utilizing cards like Lórien Revealed and The Modern Age, the deck aims to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck can effectively control the pace of the game and outlast opponents. Additionally, the inclusion of creatures like Guardian of the Guildpact provides additional protection and pressure on the opponent.

The key focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The deck includes a variety of counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce to stop threats, along with removal spells like Cast Down and Snuff Out to deal with creatures. Card advantage is provided through cards like Deep Analysis and Brainstorm, while threats like Gurmag Angler and Thorn of the Black Rose can help close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through control and strategic play.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creature cards, then using reanimation spells like Exhume and Dread Return to bring powerful creatures back onto the battlefield. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of big creatures and graveyard recursion, taking advantage of the low mana cost and high value of the creatures in the deck. The synergy between cards like Stinkweed Imp, Satyr Wayfinder, and Scrapwork Mutt helps facilitate this strategy, while also providing some versatility in handling different types of threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts with the Affinity mechanic to quickly flood the board with creatures and enable powerful spells. By sacrificing cheap artifacts with cards like Makeshift Munitions and Fanatical Offering, it can deal damage directly to the opponent or trigger additional effects. The deck also incorporates cards like Nihil Spellbomb to disrupt opponents' strategies and Thoughtcast to draw into more resources. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, it aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced, artifact-heavy strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies by utilizing a mix of creatures, artifacts, and spells to control the battlefield and deal damage to the opponent quickly. The key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature sacrificing, land destruction, and card draw, while also maintaining a strong presence on the board with resilient creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to generate value through sacrificing artifacts and creatures, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with land destruction and removal spells.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells in order to win the game as fast as possible. This Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype relies on a combination of low-cost creatures like Goblin Tomb Raider and clockwork machines, as well as efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. By applying constant pressure and dealing consistent damage, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can establish a strong defense.

This white weenie aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures like Kor Skyfisher, Thraben Inspector, and Salt Road Packbeast, supported by anthems like Guardians' Pledge and Battle Screech. By efficiently utilizing these small creatures and trick spells like Prismatic Strands and Thraben Charm, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Greatsword of Tyr and Suture Priest provides additional utility and resilience against various threats.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive playstyle using artifacts and sacrificing creatures for advantage. By using cards like Myr Enforcer and Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on while also maintaining card advantage through artifacts like Ichor Wellspring and Thoughtcast. The inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Mistvault Bridge further disrupt the opponent's strategy while cards like Reckoner's Bargain and Fanatical Offering provide utility and additional ways to close out the game.
